abstract: Prolonged nuclear negotiations with Iran have laid bare growing divide between nation's hard-liners and those who seem ready to move past orthodoxy of 1979 revolution; hard-liners retain deep animosity toward West and oppose any concessions, while more moderate counterparts seek agreement that will lift sanctions and lead to more stable life.
lead_paragraph: As a vocal group rails against a nuclear deal, a seemingly larger group of Iranians long for a deal they say would help them and the country advance.

headline.main: Divide on Iran Nuclear Deal: Hard-Liners vs. ‘Invisible People’
headline.print_headline: Iran’s Hard-Liners Overshadow ‘Invisible People’ Who Want Deal

snippet: As a vocal group rails against a nuclear deal, a seemingly larger group of Iranians long for a deal they say would help them and the country advance.
